section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Lord of the world, this is Your lamp-lit worship service.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

author.author: Saint Dhana
author.description:
Saint Dhana [1415 - 1475], whose three hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib, was born to a poor Hindu farmer family of Jat caste in the village of Dhuan Kalan located in the Tonk region of Rajasthan. From his very childhood, Saint Dhana was very simple, hardworking and innocent. He enjoyed being in the company of saints and scholars and soon became a follower of the famous Saint Ramanand.

It is written that Saint Dhana asked a Brahmin about God who gave him a stone to worship. Dhana offered food and milk to the stone, and refused to eat till God accepted his food. Through this innocent love and pure devotion, God appeared before him and the fields Dhana was going to plow with seeds, began to produce grains without them.

text: ਜੋ ਜਨ ਤੁਮਰੀ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰੰਤੇ ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ਕਾਜ ਸਵਾਰਤਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are the Arranger of the affairs of those humble beings who perform Your devotional worship service. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jō jan tumarī bhagat karantē tin kē kāj savāratā .1. rahāu .

section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Lentils, flour and ghee - these things, I beg of You.

melody.description: Dhanasari is a sense of being completely carefree. This sensation arises from a feeling of contentment and ‘richness’ from the things we have in our lives and gives the listener a positive and optimistic attitude towards the future.

section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My mind shall ever be pleased.

text: ਪਨ੍ਹੀਆ ਛਾਦਨੁ ਨੀਕਾ ॥ ਅਨਾਜੁ ਮਗਉ ਸਤ ਸੀ ਕਾ ॥੧॥
section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Shoes, fine clothes, and grain of seven kinds - I beg of You. ||1||

transliteration.text: panhīā shādan nīkā . anāj magau sat sī kā .1.

translation.text: A milk cow, and a water buffalo, I beg of You,

section: Dhanasari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: - Your humble servant Dhanna begs for these things, Lord. ||2||4||
